description.p: This release improves moddability by externalizing previously hard-coded data into ExternalData/DarkForces/ and allows for many properties of effects, pickups, projectiles, and weapons to be changed. In addition, first pass scripting integration has been implemented in the form of script functions that can be called from INF. Please visit the GitHub release page for a detailed list of user-facing changes.

It has been months since the last official release. While most of my work has been directed towards the Level Editor, there still have been a large number of changes and improvements that have accumulated in that time frame, many from contributors. Please visit the GitHub release page for a detailed list of user-facing changes.
This was the initial release of The Force Engine as a Flatpak. Please visit the GitHub release page for a detailed list of user-facing changes.
A bug-fix release, with some improvements to the Accessibility UI, slight improvements to true color texture color accuracy, more work on the TFE editor, and mostly bug fixes.
Fixed a silly shader mistake that only affects the 8-bit GPU renderers.
A quick bug-fix release following up version 1.09.4.
The "Bloom" release, adding modern graphics features and a first beta of subtitle/closed caption support.
Bug fix release for more issues found in v1.09.
Hotfix release that addresses critical issues with version 1.09.
An interim release adding mostly features for MIDI support along with some more Linux-specific bug fixes and improvements.
A small release to capture Linux fixes.
This build contains most of the features slated for version 1.10, with the only major missing feature being internal midi synth support. This marks the first TFE release with Linux support.
A minor release introducing some quality-of-life features and more bug fixes.
Bug fix release for The Force Engine version 1.0.
Version 1.0 Release of The Force Engine with full Dark Forces support including mods.
